result.reason: Users with non-standard monitor setups (vertical, multi-monitor spans) need arbitrary RDP resolutions beyond the hardcoded enum list; mstsc.rdp already supports custom values so it's technically feasible.
result.approach: Add a 'Custom' entry to the RDPResolutions enum; when selected, expose ResolutionWidth/ResolutionHeight integer properties on ConnectionInfo that feed directly into the RDP ActiveX DesktopWidth/DesktopHeight. Update serializers to persist the custom values.

attempts.raw_output:
The issue is clear. The user wants custom (arbitrary) RDP resolution support instead of the hardcoded enum list. This would require changing the `RDPResolutions` enum approach to support user-defined width/height values.
